content: Excellent and comprehensive.
Fantastic. Would be better if you can train through all the variations in one go
Realy amazing app to train my chess oppening.

Edit: adjusted back to 3 stars as most of the app is fine. The inability to have multiple moves available in a single position is a weakness in my opinion. Another is that, even in 'full coverage' training mode the app brings up lines that have been seen many times while there are plenty of lines that are completely untouched. It seems like you have to train the entire set of lines in 1 sitting to get to 100% coverage. These 2 issues fixed and the app is easily 5 stars.
replyContent: If you are creating an opening for Black, remember that you can only enter one move for Black, which would be your favorite move for the chessboard position you are facing. So if White's first move is 1.d4, then you must choose your favorite move either 1...d5 or 1...Nf6. Hope this helps. For any question, email us at beadapps.help@gmail.com

content: Great app that allows you to enter and practice the openings. You can also enter the probability of occurrence. The only negative comment I have is that you can only play one move in a given position.
replyContent:
Hi,
We've forwarded your feedback to our developers. Thank you for taking out the time to send us your suggestions!

My suggestion is to prepare a variation index from pgn file as well.

content: Only 1 day in but I like the app a lot and can see it's benefit. Only thing I haven't figured is sometimes the play button flashes in training and doesn't seem to load a computer move in? replyContent:
To assist with this issue, it would be helpful to have a more information. Can you send detailed steps to reproduce the issue at beadapps.help@gmail.com? 
Also please note that at the end of a line the play button will be flashing white. You need to press on it to resume with the next line or long press on it to play against the computer. Thanks.

content: Very useful, Not only can you input whatever opening line you want and drill it, but their is also a flashcard feature which randomly pulls up different positions in the line your trying to memorize and asks you to make the right move. If you mess up it'll circle back to that position over and over until you got it down perfect. Its like the chessbase opener, instead without the database but on COT its easier to set up openings than on chessbase. 5 stars.
replyContent: Hello, thanks for the nice review! Glad that you like the app.

content: Is there a good place I can find openings to import? Most important openings should be built-in for the app.
replyContent:
Adding built-in openings would increase the size of the app and many users don't like to install apps that take up a lot of space on their device.
There are many websites where you can download PGN files. For example this one: https://www.pgnmentor.com

content: Simply excellent. As a beginning chess player used to spaced repetition systems in language learning I knew exactly what I wanted to memorize the most basic chess openings and this application is just that. Add the moves you want to memorize and play against an opponent that adheres to the lines you want exclusively.
replyContent: Thanks for this great review! Glad to see that you enjoy training based on spaced repetition. It's probably be the most powerful technique in existence for improving your brain's ability to recall what you study. Happy chess training!

content: Would be better if I can select a position to start training from instead of the program randomly selecting.
replyContent: Hi, thanks for your comment. What you are asking for is very easy to achieve. All you need to do is create a specific topic for this: copy to clipboard the FEN of the starting position and then create a new game using this FEN and enter (or import) the moves you want to train.

content: I will give 5 star if we can import pgn till 100 move.this app can only 25 move in import pgn.... I see. It updated. so now we can import pgn 40 move. Great progress. I hope you can improve it to 50 move... Ok i give you 5 star... Please update it till 50 move. thanks
replyContent: This app can import 40 moves (not 25). Do you know that he average duration of a game (played by humans) is about 40 moves? That is true, based on statistics provided by the Chessgames database (685,801) games, the average number of moves is 40.04. You must also keep in mind that the purpose of this app is to train the "openings"...

content: good app. the pgn import misses moves, i.e. some moves are not imported
replyContent:
Remember that this app is not a PGN viewer, it's a trainer!

When creating an opening, you can enter only one move of your own color, and enter all moves that your opponent could reply. This is true whether you enter the moves manually or automatically using a PGN file.

Because of this, not all moves will be imported from the PGN file.

content: Had been looking for an app that would allow me to create my own opening theory and then train myself with it. This fits the bill!

I had been looking for something like this for a while and finally found it! Namely, being able to practice an opening when the "opponent" sometimes has more than one choice. (Other tools I had tried only supported following a single line, not a tree.) I also wanted something that could work offline, which this app supports.  My only suggestion would be to add a PGN export feature. It's great that we can import PGNs, but what if I created a repertoire using the app but then would like to edit it using a different program?

useful app..if there is option to create different folders for openings and also if there is option to search specific opening then it will be much more useful especially when there are many openings in the list..sort feature also can be added

content: This is such a fantastic companion to a book on openings. You can set up main lines and variations and then get drilled on them until you know them cold. Easy to use and very helpful.

content: The best repertoire app on Android. Love it. I'd like to be able to use coloured squares and arrows to highlight important squares and lines though. Also, you can only create one line within each repertoire for that particular colour. It would be good to be able to create alternative lines. You can create alternative moves for the opposite colour, which does create new lines, but only via this method.

Edit: Support responded to my issue very promptly and released an update that fixed it within hours. This is now a 5 star app for me. I like it, but I'm unable to backup due to FileNotFoundException. I used a file manager to manually create the location but unfortunately that did not work either. In any case I think it should be possible to choose the export location like you can do with restore location. As long as I can't backup I'm reluctant to use the app as I might lose all my data if my phone dies.

I am looking something like this to practice on my repertoire on my android phone now I don't need my PC anymore. My suggestion is somehow to make it easier on training to choose another move for variation not to go on edit and replace another candidate move to high occurrence and proceed again to training what if I have multiple candidate move that I need for training.
Very useful. Simple and straightforward.

really one of the best app I had ever seen for creating your opening repertoire. but needs a little improvement as variations hangs and system might confuse at some moments and show wrong and extra moves by itself
